title: Mum tells gay couple at bus stop 'kiss behind closed doors' in homophobic attack
text:

This is the moment a mum hurls homophobic abuse at a gay couple after it was claimed she saw them kissing at a bus stop.

The couple, who have asked to remain anonymous, shared footage from the incident in a bid to spread awareness on the 'hate crimes in London'

The woman in her car had pulled up at the bus stop, with another female with her, before confronting the two men.

Recording the encounter on his mobile phone one of the men asks the driver: "Say that again, please."

She leans across and replies: "I said, you're not going to be kissing your little boyfriend in the street, I've got a f****** son. You're not going to do it. No, you're not. You do that behind closed doors."

When one of the men asks: "Do you think we're going to stop now you've said?", the driver hurls back: "You can do what you want.

(Image: Facebook)

"My son is not going to grow up like you to think it's right to get stabbed in your arse."

As they pull away the someone can be heard shouting: "F****** b*** boys. B**** b***."

The "hate incident" is the latest in a string of attacks after couple Melania Geymonat, 28, from Uruguay, and partner Chris, 29, were left bloodied following an alleged attack on a nightbus.

The Ryanair stewardess and her girlfriend say they were attacked by a gang of young men who allegedly demanded they kiss each other.

Now a friend of the couple has shared the footage in a bid to highlight the risks that marginalised couples can face.

She said: "My best friend and his boyfriend were stopped by these women and verbally harassed for kissing at a bus stop in London

"It scares me how backwards people are when we think we’re making progress on being a more open and accepting country."

The Metropolitan Police has been contacted for comment.
description: EXCLUSIVE: The woman driver hurled homophobic abuse at the men who she told "my son is not going to grow up like you" after spotting them kissing at a bus stop
